meanings.definition: relating to the study and treatment of tumors
meanings.sent1: The oncologic team worked together to develop a treatment plan for the patient.
meanings.sent2: The hospital had a dedicated oncologic department for cancer patients.
meanings.sent3: The oncologic researchers celebrated a successful breakthrough in tumor research.
meanings.sent4: Her dedication to oncologic research shone brightly in the medical community.
meanings.sent5: The oncologic approach to tumor treatment was innovative and effective.

meanings.definition: a branch of medicine dealing with tumors
meanings.sent1: She decided to pursue a career in oncologic to help cancer patients.
meanings.sent2: The oncologic department at the hospital was well-equipped to handle various cases.
meanings.sent3: The oncologic field constantly strives to improve cancer treatment methods.
meanings.sent4: His passion for oncologic was evident in his commitment to patient care.
meanings.sent5: The advancements in oncologic have significantly improved survival rates.

meanings.definition: a person who specializes in the study and treatment of cancer
meanings.sent1: The oncologic was known for his compassionate approach to patient care.
meanings.sent2: She consulted with an experienced oncologic to discuss treatment options.
meanings.sent3: The oncologic joked that tumors were like puzzles waiting to be solved.
meanings.sent4: His reputation as an oncologic was built on years of dedicated service.
meanings.sent5: The oncologic's expertise in cancer treatment was highly respected in the medical community.
